html:
12.22.22  1:04 am   What is the world's hardest question?

      an unknown question. that's what makes a question hard. not knowing it. more than not knowing the answer, i'm talkin about not knowing the question. take it a step even further, how about not even knowing whether or not there is a question. i was going to take it another step even further and say it's even harder when you don't even suspect the possibility that there could be a question, but that's actually way easier because you don't think about it. so, in conclusion, the hardest question is when you think there might be a question but you're not sure if there is

12.21.22  11:32 pm   what does 1x42x86x7= its my homewordk idk what it is help pls

      49x12x43

12.21.22  10:08 pm   What would you do if you are in a room with another person alone waiting for some other people to come in, but you dont want to make any conversation at all?

      think about what you would write, in a book you could write about what to do in this situation

12.21.22  9:04 pm   How do I stop having stress and anxiety about anything?

     just worry about everything, then you'll be all set

     Oh and what is life's biggest life ?

      i'm not sure

12.21.22  6:48 pm   how to win arguments

      see if you can find that sweetspot between wrong and right

12.21.22  6:39 pm   what even is probability

      how likely it is for a particular thing to happen

12.21.22  5:44 pm   I am contemplating on purchasing a rooster, he will be named Reginald if I do,

     unless you know exactly which rooster it will be, then the name is gonna be extremely ingenuine

      should I do it?

     sure. or sometimes it's fun to flip it around and let the rooster purchase you

     Or should I go to a theme park instead?

     maybe you could purchase the theme park. flip that around, sell it, then go to the rooster

      The real question is, how much is a Starbucks venti?

     probably like 100 bucks

     It's all theoretical wouldn't you agree?

     only if you haven't actually seen the price for yourself

12.21.22  2:43 pm   Is your song "might quit" about your journey switching to a new animation program?

      no

12.21.22  1:09 pm   you a fan of stairs?

      yes. i'm thinking of starting a stairs fan club

12.21.22  12:33 pm   Do you ever go back and listen to your old songs?

     occasionally

     If so, how often

     not very

     and for what reason(s)?

     to either love or hate myself

12.21.22  10:49 am   holy shit, that strategy of deliberately making something as poorly as possible and then making it good later is actually so damn good. it's got me drawing more than ever before. thanks for that advice bill

      you're welcome

12.21.22  9:59 am   how can i make music better than everyone else?

      this is totally impossible until that moment after you do it when you realize you've done it

12.21.22  9:34 am   how do I know if I've walked past my school?

      you may not like this, but you might have to learn to recognize your school, either visually or otherwise

12.21.22  9:21 am   what when the did you where bill 

      (luther vandross voice) "here and now"

12.21.22  8:52 am   do you remember anything from your current life

      yes

12.21.22  8:21 am   In the music video of "here comes the sun", is the rain (0:45) a reference to the older version of the song?

      it feels like it, but it's probably just a more general reference to one of the most common sunless circumstances we experience here on earth. to set up the bright return of the sun, in the chorus

12.21.22  7:28 am   How many cars drive through Perfect Heights during the video?

      2000

12.21.22  6:15 am   Are the one-way stairs ("september") a metaphor for the linear, one-way nature of time?

     their purpose in that moment was to contradict the previous line, but it does work pretty well as a metaphor for time

      The toy piano sound right after that line makes me think of childhood, and of wanting to go back in time.

     i didn't think of that but it does work, except for the fact that the melody/riff played on that piano there is definitely for adults only

12.21.22  3:45 am   how the heck do i give myself perfect pitch

      basically you'd have to somehow remove all the programming in your brain that enjoys music. (then after that just learn the notes one by one, then you'll know just the notes and none of the music to distract). fortunately for you this is impossible i think

12.21.22  1:24 am   I've been told that I should be able to see that a movement like [G7 Cmaj7] and [C7 Fmaj7] are the same, and also hear them as the same, but I don't get it. Would you please explain it to me?

      what they are probably trying to tell you is something you'd really only know by hearing it for yourself. has anyone ever showed you the trick where they play 'row row row your boat' starting on C, then they play the same song starting on Ab and it still sounds like the song even though it's different notes

12.21.22  12:37 am   what classifies as a tool?

      any thing, and many non-things as well

12.21.22  12:26 am   how did you create the sound that accompanies everything disappearing in 'how to pull a rabbit out of a hat'?

      that seems to be a bass slide, and a percussion sound. the percussion sound is like a high click, then put big long reverb on that click, then for a period of time during the reverb, add a hard tremolo and then take it off

12.20.22  11:33 pm   do you think bruce springsteen could ever win enough votes to be governor of new jersey?

     possibly

      like just for fun

     i hope that's not why anyone gets into the government

12.20.22  10:30 pm   what is your opinion on capital letters 

      very good. decent size. they command attention, as long as you don't put them in too predictable of a location

12.20.22  9:10 pm   im high what should i do now while im still stimulated

      get to work

12.20.22  8:18 pm   How do you make your videos?

      hold back 90% of the way, so that when the other 10% gets out of control, it will still be on track

12.20.22  7:24 pm   help, i started trying to work with people on creative projects and it's going terribly. all my ideas are ten million miles away and completely alien to the others. and my mind is exploding because i have to compromise to satisfy the others ideas, and i don't have enough time to make My things by myself.what would you suggest i do? do i just have the wrong people? 

      try working alone again

      173

      no

      no

      no

12.20.22  4:27 pm   can you explain why the moon has those dark spots on it

      it's probably hills and valleys, which make shadows. the shadows are especially dramatic because there's really no sky

12.20.22  3:17 pm   do you like buckets

      yes

      you get to make another universe simulator inside the simulator

      6 to 12

12.20.22  11:20 am   do you think i would look good with huge muscles?

      i'm having trouble imagining it

12.20.22  10:41 am   if it's neither here nor there, where is it?

      could be everywhere

12.20.22  9:55 am   Bill, you Magical Mugician (musician magician) ... What is the chord at the start of "A Hard Day's Night" By the Beatles?

      sounds like G7sus4, feels like D is in the bass but that's just what i would do. listening it sounds like the bass is playing D but you can hear a low G on the piano

12.20.22  9:15 am   How do I prove that anything is real?

      first you have to figure out what you mean by real. after that it's pretty easy

12.20.22  8:20 am   how do i get over perfectionism especially when it comes to my music?

      do some really bad things. you will love it

12.20.22  7:33 am   can i be your friend

      sure

12.20.22  6:30 am   What the hell is normal?

      change

      was it this one

12.20.22  3:02 am   Do you remember the real location from the "Perfect." video? Like the road name, or the name of the plaza?

      i know exactly where it is

12.20.22  2:12 am   WHY DO YOU DISLIKE CAPITAL LETTERS SO MUCH? I THINK THEY'RE FUN. YOU SHOULD USE THEM MORE

      i use them more than most people, especially for fun. i'd say most people use most of their capitals for non-fun, like Kind Regards and stuff like that. what the heck is a Regard anyway?

      how exactly are you measuring that

      music helps

      you
